name: Maui Girl's Mango Pie
author: mauigirl
summary: If you like peach pie, you will love this dreamy tropical pie. It has a brighter flavor with the added beauty of this luscious island fruit. This recipe came about after I was gifted with a large bag of mangoes by an anonymous Maui neighbor. I was determined to use every single one of them and by adapting an apple pie recipe, I came up with this delicious pie. Another bonus.....the sweetness of the mangoes reduces the need for added sugar.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon butter, cut into small chunks
directions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Line a 9-inch pie pan with half of the pie pastry
Combine mango, sugar, cornstarch, lemon juice, and cinnamon in a bowl; stir until the sugar has dissolved
Transfer mango mixture into the prepared pie pan
Dot the mixture with the butter, then cover with the top crust
Pinch the edges of the top and bottom crusts together to seal
Cut several vents on the top crust
Bake in the preheated oven until the crust is golden brown and the juices are bubbling, about 45 minutes
